etymology.description: semantic: 氵(氵) (shuǐ, "water") + phonetic: 酉(酉) (yǒu, "complete cycle") = a liquid associated with 酉 (fermentation/vessels) -> alcohol
etymology.interpretation: The character 酒(酒) (jiǔ, "alcohol") uses 氵(氵) (shuǐ, "water") to indicate a liquid, and 酉(酉) (yǒu, "complete cycle") to suggest fermentation or storage vessels, representing alcoholic beverages.

examples.chinese: 他喝了太多酒(他喝了太多酒)。
夜深人静时(夜深人靜時)，他独自品酒(他獨自品酒)。
examples.pinyin: Yè shēn rén jìng shí, tā dúzì pǐn jiǔ.
examples.english: In the quiet of the night, he savored his drink alone.

examples.chinese: 那杯香醇的酒(那杯香醇的酒)，令他回味无穷(令他回味無窮)。
examples.pinyin: Nà bēi xiāngchún de jiǔ, lìng tā huíwèi wúqióng.
examples.english: That glass of aromatic alcohol left him with an unforgettable aftertaste.
